title: Math Operations with Fractions
description: Fractions can be fun! Solve problems with different denominators, mixed numbers, and complex fractions.

questions.question: Convert the mixed number $ 1 \frac{1}{2} $ to an improper fraction.
Convert the mixed number $ 1 \frac{1}{3} $ to an improper fraction.
Convert the mixed number $ 2 \frac{1}{2} $ to an improper fraction.
Convert the mixed number $ 2 \frac{1}{3} $ to an improper fraction.
Convert the mixed number $ 3 \frac{1}{2} $ to an improper fraction.
Convert the mixed number $ 3 \frac{1}{4} $ to an improper fraction.
Convert the mixed number $ 1 \frac{2}{3} $ to an improper fraction.
Convert the mixed number $ 2 \frac{3}{4} $ to an improper fraction.
Convert the mixed number $ 1 \frac{3}{5} $ to an improper fraction.
Convert the mixed number $ 2 \frac{1}{4} $ to an improper fraction.
Convert the improper fraction $ \frac{7}{3} $ to a mixed number.
Convert the improper fraction $ \frac{9}{4} $ to a mixed number.

A baker used $ \frac{1}{3} $ of a $ 30 $ kg bag of flour. How many kilograms of flour are left?
